meanings.definition: A barrier made of upright wooden posts or stakes, especially for defense.
meanings.sent1: The stockading around the fort kept the enemies out.
meanings.sent2: The soldiers built a stockading to protect their camp.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to climb the stockading but got stuck halfway.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was a stockading against all the negativity around her.
meanings.sent5: The stockading stood tall and strong, a symbol of safety and security.

meanings.definition: To surround or fortify with a stockade.
meanings.sent1: They began stockading the perimeter of the village to keep it safe.
meanings.sent2: The settlers were stockading their homes against potential threats.
meanings.sent3: The kids playfully stockaded their makeshift fort with sticks and leaves.
meanings.sent4: His love for her stockaded his heart from any other affection.
meanings.sent5: The general stockaded his troops, ready for any attack.
